thread.title: Oscars 2017: Twitter reacts to La La Land/Moonlight mix-up with Steve Harvey memes and congratulations | The Independent
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017: Twitter reacts to La La Land/Moonlight mix-up with Steve Harvey memes and congratulations | The Independent

author: Jack Shepherd
title: Oscars 2017: Twitter reacts to La La Land/Moonlight mix-up with Steve Harvey memes and congratulations | The Independent
text:
Monday 27 February 2017 05:48 GMT Click to followThe Independent Culture 
Everything was going remarkably smoothly at the Oscars on Sunday night. Predictably, Mahershala Ali was named best supporting actor , Viola Davis best supporting, Emma Stone best leading actres s and Casey Affleck best lead. 
Many suspected La La Land would scoop the top prize and, as expected, it did. For a minute. 
Warren Beaty announced how Damien Chazelle’s film had taken the Best Picture gong when, in reality, it was Moonlight that won. 
Twitter erupted into a fountain of Steve Harvey references, memes, and - mainly - excitement, as the most predictable winner in history wasn’t handed the Oscar. Congrats to Moonlight!! — Miles Teller (@Miles_Teller) February 27, 2017 Wh ??!congratulations Moonlight! My favorite #Oscars in memory!! — Oprah Winfrey (@Oprah) February 27, 2017 Whoa! What a twist ending! Congrats to the well-deserved #Moonlight for your incredible win! — Kermit the Frog (@KermitTheFrog) February 27, 2017 The La La Land producer who had to announce that Moonlight won best Picture is Jordan Horowitz. What a gentleman. — Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) February 27, 2017 Steve Harvey sitting at the crib like... — Carl Davis (@Carldavis94) February 27, 2017 The real winner tonight: Steve Harvey #Oscars pic.twitter.com/N5ZGYZr0Kz
